intro: Sisymbrium arcticum, commonly known as the arctic tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sisymbrium arcticum is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
